# **Rising Temperature**

## Find all dates' IDs with higher temperature compared to the previous day.

### Table Schema
| Column      | Type |
|-------------|------|
| id          | INT  |
| recordDate  | DATE |
| temperature | INT  |

### Example

**Input:**
```
**Weather**
+----+------------+-------------+
| id | recordDate | temperature |
+----+------------+-------------+
| 1  | 2015-01-01 | 10          |
| 2  | 2015-01-02 | 25          |
| 3  | 2015-01-03 | 20          |
| 4  | 2015-01-04 | 30          |
+----+------------+-------------+
```

**Expected Output:**
```
+----+
| id |
+----+
| 2  |
| 4  |
+----+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Weather(id INT, recordDate DATE, temperature INT); INSERT INTO Weather VALUES (1,'2015-01-01',10),(2,'2015-01-02',25),(3,'2015-01-03',20),(4,'2015-01-04',30);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT w1.id FROM Weather w1 JOIN Weather w2 ON julianday(w1.recordDate) - julianday(w2.recordDate) = 1 WHERE w1.temperature > w2.temperature;
